intro: Asyneuma attenuatum, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers make it distinctive in its native environment. Asyneuma attenuatum is often found in regions with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
